feels.name: Trust
feels.quote: Dorothea had early begun to emerge from that stupidity, but yet it had been easier to her to imagine how she would devote herself to Mr. Casaubon, and become wise and strong in his strength and wisdom.

feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: Mr. Casaubon felt a surprise which was quite unmixed with pleasure.

feels.name: Anger
feels.quote: Mr. Casaubon felt a surprise which was quite unmixed with pleasure.

feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: Dorothea's eyes followed her husband anxiously, while he sank down wearily at the end of a sofa, and resting his elbow supported his head and looked on the floor.

feels.name: Anticipation
feels.quote: Dorothea's eyes followed her husband anxiously, while he sank down wearily at the end of a sofa, and resting his elbow supported his head and looked on the floor.

feels.name: Fear
feels.quote: Dorothea's eyes followed her husband anxiously, while he sank down wearily at the end of a sofa, and resting his elbow supported his head and looked on the floor.

feels.name: Disgust
feels.quote: But Dorothea remembered it to the last with the vividness with which we all remember epochs in our experience when some dear expectation dies, or some new motive is born.

feels.name: Sadness
feels.quote: But Dorothea remembered it to the last with the vividness with which we all remember epochs in our experience when some dear expectation dies, or some new motive is born.

feels.name: Acceptance
feels.quote: But Dorothea remembered it to the last with the vividness with which we all remember epochs in our experience when some dear expectation dies, or some new motive is born.
